verses.text_plain: Then Naomi her mother in law said unto her, My daughter, shall I not seek rest for thee, that it may be well with thee?
verses.verse_html: 1Then Naomi her mother in law said unto her, My daughter, shall I not seek rest for thee, that it may be well with thee?

tokens.text: for thee, that it may be well

verses.text_plain: And now is not Boaz of our kindred, with whose maidens thou wast? Behold, he winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor.
verses.verse_html: 2And now is not Boaz of our kindred, with whose maidens thou wast? Behold, he winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor.

verses.text_plain: Wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thy raiment upon thee, and get thee down to the floor: but make not thyself known unto the man, until he shall have done eating and drinking.
verses.verse_html: 3Wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thy raiment upon thee, and get thee down to the floor: but make not thyself known unto the man, until he shall have done eating and drinking.

tokens.text: upon thee, and get thee down

verses.text_plain: And it shall be, when he lieth down, that thou shalt mark the place where he shall lie, and thou shalt go in, and uncover his feet, and lay thee down; and he will tell thee what thou shalt do.
verses.verse_html:
4And it shall be, when he lieth down, that thou shalt mark the place where he shall lie, and thou shalt go in, and uncover his feet, and lay thee down; and he will tell thee what thou shalt do. ▼
▼ uncover: or, lift up the clothes that are on

tokens.text: And it shall be, when he lieth down

footnotes.body_text: ▼ uncover: or, lift up the clothes that are on
footnotes.body_html: ▼ uncover: or, lift up the clothes that are on

verses.text_plain: And she said unto her, All that thou sayest unto me I will do.
verses.verse_html: 5And she said unto her, All that thou sayest unto me I will do.

tokens.text: unto her, All that thou sayest

verses.text_plain: And she went down unto the floor, and did according to all that her mother in law bade her.
verses.verse_html: 6And she went down unto the floor, and did according to all that her mother in law bade her.

tokens.text: according to all that her mother in law

verses.text_plain: And when Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn: and she came softly, and uncovered his feet, and laid her down.
verses.verse_html: 7And when Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn: and she came softly, and uncovered his feet, and laid her down.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass at midnight, that the man was afraid, and turned himself: and, behold, a woman lay at his feet.
verses.verse_html:
8And it came to pass at midnight, that the man was afraid, and turned himself: and, behold, a woman lay at his feet. ▼
▼ turned: or, took hold on

tokens.text: And it came to pass at midnight

footnotes.body_html: ▼ turned: or, took hold on

verses.text_plain: And he said, Who art thou? And she answered, I am Ruth thine handmaid: spread therefore thy skirt over thine handmaid; for thou art a near kinsman.
verses.verse_html:
9And he said, Who art thou? And she answered, I am Ruth thine handmaid: spread therefore thy skirt over thine handmaid; for thou art a near kinsman. ▼
▼ a near…: or, one that hath right to redeem

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a near…: or, one that hath right to redeem
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a near…: or, one that hath right to redeem

verses.text_plain: And he said, Blessed be thou of the Lord, my daughter: for thou hast shewed more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning, inasmuch as thou followedst not young men, whether poor or rich.
verses.verse_html: 10And he said, Blessed be thou of the Lord, my daughter: for thou hast shewed more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning, inasmuch as thou followedst not young men, whether poor or rich.

verses.text_plain: And now, my daughter, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou requirest: for all the city of my people doth know that thou art a virtuous woman.
verses.verse_html:
11And now, my daughter, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou requirest: for all the city of my people doth know that thou art a virtuous woman. ▼
▼ city: Heb. gate

tokens.text: to thee all that thou requirest

verses.text_plain: And now it is true that I am thy near kinsman: howbeit there is a kinsman nearer than I.
verses.verse_html: 12And now it is true that I am thy near kinsman: howbeit there is a kinsman nearer than I.

verses.text_plain: Tarry this night, and it shall be in the morning, that if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman, well; let him do the kinsman’s part: but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee, then will I do the part of a kinsman to thee, as the Lord liveth: lie down until the morning.
verses.verse_html: 13Tarry this night, and it shall be in the morning, that if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman, well; let him do the kinsman’s part: but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee, then will I do the part of a kinsman to thee, as the Lord liveth: lie down until the morning.

tokens.text: and it shall be in the morning
if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman
let him do the kinsman’s part
not do the part of a kinsman
to thee, then will I do the part of a kinsman

verses.text_plain: And she lay at his feet until the morning: and she rose up before one could know another. And he said, Let it not be known that a woman came into the floor.
verses.verse_html: 14And she lay at his feet until the morning: and she rose up before one could know another. And he said, Let it not be known that a woman came into the floor.

verses.text_plain: Also he said, Bring the vail that thou hast upon thee, and hold it. And when she held it, he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her: and she went into the city.
verses.verse_html:
15Also he said, Bring the vail that thou hast upon thee, and hold it. And when she held it, he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her: and she went into the city. ▼
▼ vail: or, sheet, or, apron

footnotes.body_html: ▼ vail: or, sheet, or, apron

verses.text_plain: And when she came to her mother in law, she said, Who art thou, my daughter? And she told her all that the man had done to her.
verses.verse_html: 16And when she came to her mother in law, she said, Who art thou, my daughter? And she told her all that the man had done to her.

verses.text_plain: And she said, These six measures of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not empty unto thy mother in law.
verses.verse_html: 17And she said, These six measures of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not empty unto thy mother in law.

verses.text_plain: Then said she, Sit still, my daughter, until thou know how the matter will fall: for the man will not be in rest, until he have finished the thing this day.
verses.verse_html: 18Then said she, Sit still, my daughter, until thou know how the matter will fall: for the man will not be in rest, until he have finished the thing this day.
